creator: mika@netstock.net
text:
i use php to do ob_implicit_flush and when it call ap_rflush data is push to 
browser immediately ,but when i use this in a loop ,and keep flushing  data to 
the browser ,it will cause memory leak at server,is the brigade or bucket are 
not free?
Not an httpd bug, a php4apache2handler module bug.  You want php.net for those.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
Bonus suggestion for your patience and eagerness to debug this...

...apr_r* api is deprecated.  So yes, it will have all sorts of very
interesting side effects.  pass_brigade API's are the way to go, now.
There is a flush bucket you can create to effect your desired operation.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
jorton@redhat.com
text:
This is caused by (various) core filters using apr_brigade_split()
inappropriately, it is an httpd bug; see bug 23567.
